subject: Re: [junit] Re: Is it Time for JUnit 5
msgSnippet: ... Agreed, I don t see much benefit to this and lambdas are certainly not designed to replace straight method definition and/or calls. As far as testing goes,
messageBody:
On Wed, Jan 16, 2013 at 6:56 PM, Teemu Kanstrén <tkanstren@...> wrote:

> And instead of
>
> @ParamTest("Name")
> public void computeParameters(x param1, x param2) {
> assertTheRightThing(param1, param2);
> }
>
> you write
>
> paramTest("Name", computeParameters(), (param1, param2) -> {
> assertTheRightThing(param1, param2);
> }
>
> is this what you mean?
>
> does not seem like a huge thing to me :).
>

Agreed, I don't see much benefit to this and lambdas are certainly not
designed to replace straight method definition and/or calls. As far as
testing goes, I see lambdas being much more useful in client libraries than
testing frameworks themselves.

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
